comment:
Linear Programming (LP):A mathematical method used to determine the best outcome in a given mathematical model for a given set of constraints.
Objective function:The function that needs to be optimized in a linear programming problem, in this case, minimizing the wage bill.
Constraints:Restrictions or limitations that must be satisfied in a linear programming problem, such as the requirement to keep the weekly wage bill below $30000 and have at least 10 young adults out of 50 workers.
